zone.line: The wandering voices & the shadows these
Of all that man becomes, the mediators
Of that best worship love, by him & us
Given and returned, swift shapes & sounds which grow
More fair & soft as man grows wise & kind
And veil by veil evil & error fall . . .
Such virtue has the cave & place around .
turning to the spirit of the Hour
For thee fair Spirit one toil remains..Ione 200
Give her that curved shell, which Proteus old
Made Asia's nuptial boon, breathing within it
A voice to be accomplished, & which thou
Didst hide in grass under the hollow rock
Ione
Thou most desired h H our, more loved & lovely
Than all thy sisters . this the mystic shell
See the pale azure fading into silver
Lining it with a soft yet glowing light .
Looks it not like lulled music sleeping there?
Spirit
It seems in truth the fairest shell of Ocean 210
It's sound must be at once both sweet & strange 203
